alert.note: Alert for Coastal Chatham (Georgia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Charleston (the Southern end of South Carolina and Eastern Georgia)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 05 at 9:11AM EDT by NWS Charleston
info.description: ...BRIEF WATERSPOUTS COULD IMPACT THE BEACHES THIS MORNING... Conditions are favorable for the development of waterspouts across the waters this morning. As building clouds and isolated showers move onshore, there is a chance for any waterspouts that form to approach the beaches. Those heading to area beaches this morning should remain weather aware and be prepared to take shelter if a waterspout approaches. Waterspouts that move onshore become tornadoes. Although most waterspouts are weak and dissipate quickly after moving onshore, they can still cause damage. Be prepared to take quick action if the waterspout approaches your location. Move to an interior room and away from windows.
info.instruction: Stay tuned to NOAA Weather Radio All Hazards or the Internet for the latest information from the National Weather Service.
